result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mario J Perez

records.addlTxt: CONDITIONS MODIFIED ON 11/02/2022: If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to have no contact with victim A/witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key or their residences.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

10:44 AM Defendant Mario J Perez in court.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Mario J Perez.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Wolff is asking for an adjournment of the preliminary hearing. No objection by the State. The Court will adjourn the preliminary hearing. Time limits were previously waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 7, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 2, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victim A/witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key or their residences.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

3:46 PM Defendant Mario J Perez in court, in custody.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Mario J Perez. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 09:15 am.
